website_summaries.verdict: This product is a great value coming as a two pack to humanely trap small animals for release.
pros: Works well for rats and squirrels
Door works well to trap the animals
Small grid on the wire meshing makes it hard for animals to escape after being trapped
Long handle makes it easy to carry
cons: This trap will not be large enough for animals like raccoons or cats

customer_reviews.title: Great trap and easy to set
customer_reviews.text: I love growing my own vegetables and I needed another addition to the traps I already have in my garden to get the little pesky chipmunks and these trap are perfect. Very easy to use and bait. I love them!!!!! They worked the first day I set them. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Worked great on destructive squirrel!!
customer_reviews.text: The squirrel that was getting into house - chewing three different routes in as we found & closed them -caught within 30 minutes!! These are destructive animals! Will be using outside now to get rid of the others. Was worried that would close too easily, seemed the trip piece was too sensitive and after putting the top piece thru the door to hold it open it seemed to be barely held. Worried any jiggling would dislodge it and close trap door. Nope! It worked great!!
customer_reviews.author: G'ma

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: They are a lot smaller than I expected but they are PERFECT for small animals - especially chipmunks. The trip plate is super sensitive but does not go off prematurely. At first when I saw that these were from China I was REAL hesitant but the quality is perfect for the job and worth the $32 I paid for both. I put the two traps out and 3 hours later they are both occupied by chipmunks - I use sunflower seeds. I've reused them 3 times now (6 chipmunks) and they don't appear to have any damage or deficiencies. Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Best Rodent Control
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for mice and rats. Bought 2 sets and all 4 have been the best rodent control I've found. I place a tiny piece of cracker with peanut butter way on the other end so they have to step on actuator. Door closes, they're doomed. Tried poisons, glue traps and others, to no avail. For those who wish to be kind, just load the traps in car and dump rodents in a field. For those who want them dead, just submerge in a tote or tub of water and dispose of carcass.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Traps urban rats
customer_reviews.text: I live next to a food center and frequently little wood rats come into the condo complex where I live hoping to find a peaceful life. Wood rats are attractive and intelligent and I really like them, but they destroy my garden. I use this to trap them and release them in a local preserve, where I hope they have a happy rat life. Put in a cracker with peanut butter on it and they can not resist (unless they've seen one of their friends trapped inside).
customer_reviews.author: deborah

customer_reviews.title: Easily to set up and trips easily
customer_reviews.text: There was a rating for scent. There was no overpowering smell with these when they arrived though I did not actually smell the metal. It was nice to receive 2 for only about $10 more than the cost of one as that way we could put in different locations and hopefully catch the little bugger that's been chewing on the outside wiring that runs to my solar and patio lights.
customer_reviews.author: Perry or Lori Rubinelli

customer_reviews.title: Good for small vermin.
customer_reviews.text: The chipmunks were making holes all around the outside of the house. Saw these two and while light weight, they should do the job. Well they do. Put them by the exit holes and started catching the vermin, 10 so far. A squirrel even went in one and ended up trapped. Wasn't after him, so he was happy to be released. The squirrel did bend the platform and connection bar a bit, but it was easy to straighten out and made serviceable again. Update: The squirrels have completely destroyed the trap linkage inside making them useless. I will need to move up to a better grade trap that can handle both sizes of animals.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Mol

customer_reviews.title: Trap works for rats, field mice
customer_reviews.text: These traps work. Peanut butter on the platform is all it took. Caught 2 rats eating my tomato plants outdoors and several field mice in my basement. There is a variant of this type of small trap out there which does not have the platform, it has a hook that hangs from the top of the trap that I guess the critter is supposed to bump against to trip it...that trap does NOT work...avoid that style.
customer_reviews.author: Radfahrer

customer_reviews.title: Great way to catch critters!
customer_reviews.text: We had something in the attic and I put some snap traps out and then thought I really didn't want to deal with that mess. I found the pathway they were using, set the trap and have caught 6 mice. Just dropped them in the preserve away from the houses and they can do as they wish or become food for something else. Very simple and easy to transport.
customer_reviews.author: PhysAl

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: I used this for rats. I didn’t want to put out poison in case of other animals finding them. I first tried an electronic trap; the rat/rats escaped 4 times. Next I tried the snap ones & then another plastic trap....all escaped those too. This one caught 2 rats the first night & a young possum the second night. It was easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: sydney

customer_reviews.title: Excellent trap
customer_reviews.text: Traps are well made and effective. I caught two chipmunks and 4 squirrels in the first two days using sunflower seeds as bait. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M. Beggs

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy wire mesh
customer_reviews.text: The trap door release system on this trap is the easiest to set and use of any trap I've used and I've used many different brands of live traps. Unfortunately I bought this to catch the red squirrels that are destroying my shed and found the wire mesh to flimsy and not suitable for red squirrels. It works -- caught a red squirrel -- by the time I put on my shoes and went out to retrieve the squirrel and trap the squirrel chewed thru the trap and left. There are many animals that are not as strong of chewers as squirrels and I'm sure this works great for mice, rats or chipmunks.
customer_reviews.author: jaycee

customer_reviews.title: Good but breakable.
customer_reviews.text: These traps work just fine. I took one star away because the thin "v-shaped" strip that attaches the plate to the trigger rod was mangled by the first squirrel we caught (within an hour btw!!). Anyway, I have to do some bending and repairing of that tin strip and the wire rod that forms the trigger for the trap after every squirrel now. Not sure how many more times it can be fixed. The second trap hasn't had a problem. In essence, some squirrels are squirrelier than others, and I guess the first one we caught was particularly nutso and did the most damage. Not sure I will replace with the same brand if it breaks completely.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Vermont

customer_reviews.title: (Almost) Too small for squirrels
customer_reviews.text: Barely large enough to catch a squirrel. Took many days of having the trap “snapped” with nothing inside to show for it. Large animals like squirrels will escape if they are not fully inside the trap when the door tries to close. I caught a lizard abs small mouse, but the squirrel was more elusive as the trap was not large enough to hold him well.
customer_reviews.author: NomadicTrader

customer_reviews.title: Great for mice - don't waste your money on plastic traps
customer_reviews.text: Over the years I purchased more than a dozen of the plastic live-catch mousetraps (the ones that look like tunnels) and mice destroyed most of them by chewing. These metal traps are great for mice (and probably chipmunks although I haven't tried it on them). I would not recommend these for anything bigger - the trap is too small and the wire mesh is not heavy-duty enough for something like a squirrel - get something else for those. I imagine even rats could chew through these given enough time. Easy to set and clean. Wish I had bought these before wasting money on all the plastic ones.
customer_reviews.author: GEJBOOKS

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Works well however only lasted one use the squirrel broke the trap so I guess it can't be reused I tried to fix it but it seems like there's a piece missing on something so oh well it was good while it lasted. I found some the missing parts and put it back together so we will see
customer_reviews.author: ANDREW WAITHE

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work
customer_reviews.text: I filmed this - the mice and rats will jump onto the cage or touch it and the door slams shut. So it’s basically worthless. Unless you can direct the rodent to go directly into the open door and not touch the cage at all - it’s not going to work. What did work was the kill trap, not this one. I also realized that where there is one mouse/rat, there are 30. You have a bigger problem than you think.
customer_reviews.author: jess

customer_reviews.title: NOT for red squirrels, they broke trap! Good Customer service!
customer_reviews.text: *edit* After I posted that the red squirrel broke the trap the seller contacted me and sent me a replacement. Since the I have used the trap to catch and re-locate a few chipmunks. Sunflower seeds work great to lure them! Great for chipmunks and mice. Pretty sure we had a red squirrel and it ate right through it! Evidence left as a tuft of fur....
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: Live traps
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had an influx of field rats (live in country) and these have helped catch them quick especially the big ones. They can’t steal the cheese without triggering the door an whoosh they’re caught
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer. Discover

customer_reviews.title: HIT AND MISS
customer_reviews.text: We have used about 10 of these over the last couple years. I would say that about 25% are engineered so poorly that they will not properly set- either they will not set at all or, when set, do not allow the critter to trigger the trap- as in, "Thanks for the free raisins, Suuuucker!" There has got to be better science for this idea...Sheldon?? The ones that work, however, were very successful in catching our pet chin when he decided that cage cleaning was an ideal time to make a break for it. This would have otherwise resulted in a pooping, peeing chin at large for MONTHS! He is usually caught in the trap in less than 48 hours.
customer_reviews.author: John Bellaris

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this.  Small red squirrel ate right through the door.
customer_reviews.text: These cages appear well built and were fairly easy to set. I trapped a red squirrel with a walnut. I set the trap the previous night and went out early in the morning. The door had been eaten through. What use is this, if what you are trapping can eat through the trap?
customer_reviews.author: Take my hand not my life

customer_reviews.title: My garden may stand a chance. They are fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: These work like a charm. They are so easy to use. They arrived last week and we have caught at least one chipmunk per day. Usually multiple chipmunks are caught and relocated daily. I am so excited I bought these. My neighbor ordered some too he was so impressed. Do not hesitate to buy them.
customer_reviews.author: JBird1018

customer_reviews.title: Not for squirrels
customer_reviews.text: While I have caught a few squirrels with this you have to get to them right away as the squirrels can and do break the metal mess. It's perfect for chipmunk and does catch squirrels but I've already had to repair the mess. The mechanism is good though, works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Angel118

customer_reviews.title: Great Traps !!
customer_reviews.text: I had previously written a review regarding these mouse traps stating they didn’t work. Well their customer service contacted me and they wanted to know about the problem I had with them. Once I told her she sent 2 new traps out right away. And I am Happy to say I caught my Rat the first night I put out the trap. And I took him to a new canyon to live . Great Trap ! Great Customer Service .
customer_reviews.author: TB

customer_reviews.title: Better than others... they trip everytime
customer_reviews.text: I have trapped DOZENS where other traps do not always go off. These are lightweight but strong enough. And easy to see inside.
customer_reviews.author: Bernie Cyr

customer_reviews.title: Perfect -- better than hav-a-hart (or whatever)
customer_reviews.text: These traps worked SO well. They're incredibly easy to use and the perfect size for catching house mice. I just put PB on the trigger and it worked perfectly. I was really grateful to receive two. It made getting rid of mice so much faster. And I was very happy with the price!
customer_reviews.author: Pearl Burgoff

customer_reviews.title: This trap works fast lol
customer_reviews.text: Package arrived today, and I already caught a big old rat in a couple of hours!
customer_reviews.author: Jessie N.

customer_reviews.title: Works and fairly easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: We ordered two of these and used peanut butter as bait. They were really easy to set up and we already caught two critters. The first night we caught a medium size rat. The second night we caught and a really small mouse. Both were released elsewhere without any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Marc W.

customer_reviews.title: Replaced rapidly
customer_reviews.text: I had 6 of these. I ordered 2 more and they came squished from a gallon on liquid paraffin, but they were replaced within 24-hours with a similar quality, not as good, but hopefully good enough!!
customer_reviews.author: LeeLee

customer_reviews.title: Still working great after 6 months of use!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this trap now since September and it's still working great! I even caught 2 rats in one trap today! I haven't had any rats escape or bite thru the wires. I still recommend this trap more than ever. It has outperformed my expectations. This trap works great! It's a little light weight so I check it often but so far I've caught 6 rats of various sizes with no escapees. Super easy to bait and use. Great deal for the price!
customer_reviews.author: karen

customer_reviews.title: pretty darned effective
customer_reviews.text: I have had them for 2 hours and have trapped 2 squirrels . easy to use, small enough to tuck into a corner, used peanut butter as bait. these are big fat squirrels, and I will admit I thought they would be too small. worked like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: kathryn hashem

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the job
customer_reviews.text: We had a rat problem in my business' warehouse and needed some traps. These worked fine, just they were slightly annoying to clean once we did catch a rat. All in all though its a good product for the price and value.
customer_reviews.author: Erik T

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Pack rats have broken out of these traps twice, rendering them completely useless.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Works fast. Excellent trap.
customer_reviews.text: These are the best traps ever !! Had a problem with Chipmunks and within minutes of setting the trap it worked. Caught too many to mention. Tried a variety of other traps, but these are the best. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: DH

customer_reviews.title: Good trap
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up...Have not caught anything yet...but very easy to set up.......***update***I have caught mice in this...I release them miles away from my home..One Unfortunately I did find dead..from being in hot sun..but The trap does work..I used peanut butter on bread to attract..
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to capture a chipmunk, within a day and a half, mr, chipmunk was caught and relocated.... awesome tool
customer_reviews.author: Mike Myers

customer_reviews.title: Works great for tree rats
customer_reviews.text: A colony of tree rats took over the chicken coop. We caught 11 in two nights. Just bait the trap with peanut butter, set it in their highway, and a rat will appear as if by magic. Put the rat somewhere else, reset the trap, another rat will appear in the trap. The rats couldn't escape the traps. I think they'd work for mice, too.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer M.

customer_reviews.title: Good....but......
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set however to my surprise a trapped squirrel managed to chew its way through the wire mesh trap door. So.....great for mice or chipmunks, but not for squirrels!
customer_reviews.author: Rpiecho

customer_reviews.title: Works sometimes.
customer_reviews.text: Tends to go off before animal gets inside, often sprung with nothing in it. Did catch one rat.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Worked great!
customer_reviews.text: Easily used and caught the culprit in the matter of a day or two!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer E. Casey

customer_reviews.title: Not built strong enough for NJ squirrels.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two live animal traps for squirrels. In one trap, the squirrel chewed through the metal trap door the first time I used it. The one trap was not very well made
customer_reviews.author: David R.

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: We had to get larger cage. This will hold small animals but large ones can chew their way out.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: These cages have been great. I've had a lot of vermin eating my flowers and digging up flower bulbs. This traps them very easily and is easy to release
customer_reviews.author: becky dickson

customer_reviews.title: THESE WORK...I DONT WANT TO KILL THE MICE JUST TO RELOCATE THEM!
customer_reviews.text: THESE WORK...WE LIVE IN THE COUNTRY AND HAVE A BAD RODENT PROBLEM OUTSIDE, IN OUR BARN AND SHEDS...I DONT WANT TO KILL THEM SO I TRAP AND RELOCATE!
customer_reviews.author: Lori Shaw

customer_reviews.title: They work great!
customer_reviews.text: They work great! I recommend buying two so that you can catch multiple mice at the same time. Also, use tahini instead of peanut butter. It works every time.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Much smaller than I thought
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use and easy to wash. These would only work for rats and mice as they are small and lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: They worked for a friend
customer_reviews.text: Tried to catch squirrels that got in loft of our cabin. The squirrels were to smart to be caught, haha
customer_reviews.author: Sheila J. Pollock

customer_reviews.title: Live Aminal Trap
customer_reviews.text: I've had these YISSVIC Live Animal Trap for several days now. They managed to capture a rat & squirrel overnight. These traps are working to reduce the number of rodents have in my yard...
customer_reviews.author: Horatiotdh

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The trap met all expectations. The critter was caught but could not escape.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Really works
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. Already got a couple mice. We use a small dab of peanut butter as bait. Easy peasy!
customer_reviews.author: Gayle Pfeiffer

customer_reviews.title: not as good as claimed, but seller refunded money
customer_reviews.text: one cage didn't work. too small for squirrels. seller is very good though
customer_reviews.author: I M LiVigni

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to set.
customer_reviews.text: Humanely trapped the pesky rats that had gotten into my attic.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie P. Higgins

customer_reviews.title: Squirrels chew right through the thin mesh
customer_reviews.text: We received the traps and set it up yesterday evening. On the plus side one trap has caught already one pesky squirrel. Unfortunately it was close to getting out by chewing through the thin mesh.
customer_reviews.author: david w

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: We have tried everythig!! In less than 24 hours have captured 4 using the dog food that they love for bait.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to set and just plain catches red squirrels
customer_reviews.author: Edbrgr

customer_reviews.title: Work as promised!  Would buy again!
customer_reviews.text: Caught a mouse and chipmunk within 1st few hours after receiving. In the 3 weeks I have had the traps have caught about 20 squirrels and chipmunks. Definitely a good buy !
customer_reviews.author: MrTrapper

customer_reviews.title: Great little trap.
customer_reviews.text: Caught an endless amount of chipmunks. Not big enough for red squirrels.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: didnt thing a squirrel was gonna fit. i was wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Pipnoodles

customer_reviews.title: Great trap.
customer_reviews.text: 2 weeks, 2 rats. A simple design that works wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: Darwin Meiners

customer_reviews.title: Chipmunk be gone
customer_reviews.text: Great easy to use caught eight chipmunks first day. No mess clean @easy let go
customer_reviews.author: Edmund r holmes

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: This trap worked perfectly, didn't harm the animal and we were able to release it at a nearby field.
customer_reviews.author: EinMiami

customer_reviews.title: Easy and safe
customer_reviews.text: The easiest to use mousetrap that us safe around pets.
customer_reviews.author: Bunnibird55

customer_reviews.title: To small
customer_reviews.text: Really to small and lite for a squirrel. If I had it to do over I would order a larger trap. Birds set this one off easy.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Forbus

customer_reviews.title: Gotcha!!!
customer_reviews.text: Place a little millet seed stem (by in the bird section), leave in place for a couple of days, it WILL catch them.
customer_reviews.author: JOSEPH J. LICATA

customer_reviews.title: Very effective for mice and small squirrels
customer_reviews.text: I have tried a variety of traps and have found this to be the most effective yet.
customer_reviews.author: TBJ

customer_reviews.title: Super sensitive
customer_reviews.text: We purchased these to catch chipmunks, which we have. But better yet we have also managed to catch many mice. Great traps!
customer_reviews.author: parrydise1957

customer_reviews.title: Much better then expected😄
customer_reviews.text: Though small very effective trap for 🐀🐿 and birds. A real bennifit of the size is it gives me the option to drawn rodents in large pale unlike the traditional larger trap. Of course we don’t drawn birds.
customer_reviews.author: George1914

product_meta.title: YISSVIC Live Animal Trap 2 Pack 11x4.5x6 inches Catch Release Cage for Mouse Rats Mice Rodents Squirrels and Similar Small Sized Pests
feature_bullets: Dimensions: This live animal trap is 11.02"x 4.5"x 5.91". Great humane trap for small sized animal
Humane: Our mouse traps is no poisons, chemicals, sprays, or glues. Does not kill or hurt the animal
Effective: This cage trap with spring-loaded trigger action door, ideal for catching fast-paced pest
Reusable:After releasing the animal, you can use the rat trap again saving you money
Recommended: This mouse traps suitable for indoor and outdoor use in homes, gardens,farms or so on

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars111 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
